programme.title: History of the Asian Games
programme.desc: From its beginnings to today, the Asian Games torch lighting has become a dazzling showcase of creativity and technology. Each edition brings fresh innovation, with Doha 2006’s unforgettable horse-and-rider moment still hailed as a highlight. As the 2026 Games in Japan draw near, excitement builds over what new spectacle will capture the world’s imagination.

programme.title: My Faith in Sport
programme.desc: Ramadan is a crucial period in the Islamic calendar but fasting (Sawm) can provide complications for athletes who are trying to compete at the highest level. But to what extent is fasting a negative or can it actually aid performance? We look at the life and adaptation throughout Ramadan of Adam Azim – an unbeaten professional boxer from the UK, Fares El Bakh – a weightlifter who won Qatar’s first ever Olympic gold medal, and Zainab Alema – a rugby player who is aiming to become the first player to represent England wearing a hijab.Experts in Sports Science and Nutrition from Aspetar Clinic, Qatar also add detail of the physical impact athletes encounter during Ramadan

programme.title: Team – Round 1 - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA
programme.desc: The GCL Team Round 1 opens the Rome leg at the Foro Italico. Two riders per squad chase fast, fault-free trips to set the overnight order and carry scores into Round 2. Expect tight time allowed, flowing lines, and smart tactics on stride counts and anchor placement as title contenders push for pole.

programme.title: Team – Round 1 - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA
programme.desc: The GCL Team Round 1 opens the Rome leg at the Foro Italico. Two riders per squad chase fast, fault-free trips to set the overnight order and carry scores into Round 2. programme.title: Team - Round 2 - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA
programme.desc: The decisive GCL Team Round 2. Reverse-order start from Round 1, with every rail and second counting toward the combined team total. Strategic rider swaps and cool heads over a technical track shape the podium and precious championship points in a high-stakes Roman finish.

programme.title: CSI5 - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA
programme.desc: Top combinations tackle elite CSI5* classes at the Foro Italico. A technical track, tight time allowed and related lines test precision and power, with the fastest clears advancing to a jump-off. Expect fine margins, inside turns and bold strides as riders chase ranking points and momentum for the Grand Prix.

programme.title: Grand Prix of Rome - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA
programme.desc: The 1.60m LGCT Grand Prix: one round plus jump-off for big championship points and a golden ticket to the Prague Playoffs Super Grand Prix. Huge oxers, delicate verticals and a demanding time allowed reward brave riding and perfect stride control in a high-stakes Roman finale.

programme.title: M1 -ATP 250 - European open 2025 - Brussels
programme.desc: ATP 250 European Open 2025 (10th edition) debuts in Brussels after nine years in Antwerp, staged on indoor-hard courts at Brussels Expo (Palais 12), 13–19 Oct. Draw sizes: 28-player singles / 16-team doubles. Prize money: €706,850. Expect fast, first-strike tennis, sharp returns and tie-break pressure as contenders fight for late-season ranking points and momentum toward Turin.

programme.title: My Faith in Sport - Salah
programme.desc: Exploring the importance of prayer within Islam, the episode begins with an overview of our seven athletes as they introduce themselves and why Islam is so important to them. We are also introduced to Omar Sulieman, a notable Imam, who acts as narration throughout the series and a guiding voice on the key principles of Islam. The life and career of Sofyan Amrabat is explored, showcasing his role as a key part of the Fenerbahce team in Turkey and the Moroccan national side. The Atlas Lions’ run to the semi-finals of the FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022 is explored, with the impact that Salah played in the team’s belief and positivity throughout the tournament.

programme.title: Race - Qiddiya Round - Extreme H World Cup 2025
programme.desc: Extreme H World Cup hits Qiddiya for a desert race. Hydrogen-powered Pioneer 25 SUVs face Time Trials, head-to-head heats, and a multi-car Grand Final, with energy management, tyre wear and route choice deciding positions. Expect dunes, dust and daring passes under the Tuwaiq cliffs, driver switches, and strategy on boost usage as teams chase points, manufacturer bragging rights and momentum in the sport’s new zero-emissions era. Broadcast highlights and on-board shots bring the action home.

programme.title: My Faith in Sport - Ummah
programme.desc: Ummah is an Arabic word meaning "community” – an important concept in Islam as it encourages Muslims to support and help each other especially in times of need. Zakat is one of the most important aspects in Islam - it is the principle of giving back to a community/person that needs it more than you. This episode will look into Zakat around footballers Ali-Al Hamadi and Nadia Nadim and the role it plays in their lives. Al-Hamadi is the first Iraqi to play in the Premier League with a remarkable back story – his family escaped persecution in their homeland in the early 2000s before settling, as refugees, in Liverpool. programme.desc: Explore the sporting secrets of F1. Complemented by features on historical milestones as well as race previews - GP Confidential is the perfect treat for any F1 fan.

programme.title: Chelsea vs. Liverpool - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: After their 3-1 win in May, Chelsea could enjoy back-to-back league wins over Liverpool for the first time since November 2014. Liverpool are winless in their last four Premier League games at Stamford Bridge and could lose away to Chelsea two seasons running in the league for the first time since losing three on the bounce from 2004-05 to 2006-07.

programme.title: Brentford vs. Manchester City - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Since completing a Premier League double over Manchester City in 2022-23, Brentford are winless in their last four against the Citizens in the division. programme.title: Leeds United vs. Tottenham Hotspur - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Leeds United have lost nine of their last 11 Premier League games against Tottenham Hotspur, including each of their last four in a row – their longest ever league losing run to Spurs. Tottenham have won both of their last two league visits to Elland Road and could beat Leeds United away from home three times running in the league for the very first time.

programme.title: Wolverhampton Wanderers vs Brighton & Hove Albion - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8
programme.desc: Wolves have won just two of their 14 Premier League games against Brighton and are winless in their last seven since a 1-0 triumph in December 2021 under Bruno Lage. Brighton have won each of their last four league visits to Wolves; the only sides the Seagulls have ever won 5+ successive away games against in their league history are Grimsby Town and Wolves themselves.

programme.title: Manchester United vs Sunderland - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8

programme.title: Everton vs Crystal Palace - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8
programme.desc: Everton have lost just one of their last 21 Premier League meetings with Crystal Palace, a 1-3 defeat in December 2021. programme.title: Sevilla vs Barcelona - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 8 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Sevilla have not won any of their last 19 LaLiga games against Barcelona, a run that stretches back to October 2015, losing their last seven in a row – their longest consecutive losing streak against the Catalans in the top-flight. Barcelona have avoided defeat in their last nine away LaLiga matches against Sevilla, their longest unbeaten run away to them in the competition.

programme.title: Sevilla vs Barcelona - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 8 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Sevilla have not won any of their last 19 LaLiga games against Barcelona, a run that stretches back to October 2015, losing their last seven in a row – their longest consecutive losing streak against the Catalans in the top-flight. programme.title: Real Madrid vs Villarreal -Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 8 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Real Madrid have not lost any of their last four LaLiga games against Villarreal, winning the last two, this after failing to win any of their previous four against the Yellows in the competition. They have not won three or more in a row against them in LaLiga since 2011. Villarreal have lost 17 of their 25 LaLiga away matches against Real Madrid, their highest number of away defeats against a single opponent in the competition.

programme.title: Le Havre vs Rennes - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7
programme.desc: Le Havre have lost four of their last five home games against Rennes in Ligue 1, after only losing one of the first 16. Le Havre failed to score for the third time in Ligue 1 in 2025 in their last match at Metz ; only Lyon and Paris SG have failed to score in fewer matches in the competition this calendar year among ever present teams. It was also Le Havre’s second clean sheet of the year, the lowest tally amongst all teams in Ligue 1.

programme.desc: Le Havre have lost four of their last five home games against Rennes in Ligue 1, after only losing one of the first 16. programme.title: Lille vs PSG - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7
programme.desc: Lille have won just one of their last 13 home Ligue 1 games against Paris SG, a 5-1 victory on 14 April 2019, which remains Paris Saint-Germain's biggest away defeat in the top-flight in the 21st century. Lille have lost their last two Ligue 1 matches and could suffer three consecutive defeats in the competition for the first time since December 2019-January 2020. Lille could also fail to score in three consecutive Ligue 1 games for the first time since September 2017.

programme.title: Tractor FC (IRN) vs Al Wahda FC (UAE) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - West MD2
programme.desc: This will be the first ever AFC Champions League Elite fixture between Tractor and Al Wahda; Tractor are unbeaten in home games against sides from UAE in the competition, while Al Wahda are winless in away matches against sides from Iran in the tournament. Al Wahda won their opening game of an AFC Champions League Elite campaign for the first time since 2007, beating Al-Ittihad 2-1 on the opening matchday of the 2025-26 season; the only other time they won their first two matches of an AFC Champions League Elite campaign was also in 2007.

programme.title: Chengdu Rongcheng FC vs Gangwon FC (KOR) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - East MD2
programme.desc: Chengdu Rongcheng will face Gangwon for the first time in AFC Champions League Elite; each of the last three games in the competition between teams from Korea and China have been won by the former by an exact 2-1 score, including Gangwon’s win over Shanghai Shenhua in the first round of the 2025-26 season. Gangwon beat Shanghai Shenhua 2-1 in their first ever AFC Champions League Elite game at home; the last Korean side to suffer at least one defeat in their first two games in the competition is Jeju United in 2011, while no side from Korea has suffered defeat in their first away game in the AFC Champions League Elite.

programme.title: Chengdu Rongcheng FC vs Gangwon FC (KOR) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - East MD2

Gangwon beat Shanghai Shenhua 2-1 in their first ever AFC Champions League Elite game at home; the last Korean side to suffer at least one defeat in their first two games in the competition is Jeju United in 2011, while no side from Korea has suffered defeat in their first away game in the AFC Champions League Elite.

programme.title: Johor Darul Ta’zim FC (MAS) vs FC Machida Zelvia (JPN) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - East
programme.desc: Johor Darul Ta’zim will be playing against Machida Zelvia for the first time in AFC Champions League history; Johor Darul Ta’zim are winless in their last seven games in the competition against teams from Japan, failing to score in each of the last five of these games. Machida Zelvia are the fifth Japanese club to start their debut AFC Champions League Elite campaign with a draw ; the last two such participants gained at least one point in their second game.

programme.title: Vissel Kobe (JPN) vs Melbourne City FC (AUS) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - East MD2
programme.desc: This will be the first AFC Champions League Elite fixture between Vissel Kobe and Melbourne City; City are without a win in any of their three Champions League Elite games against Japanese sides, while Kobe have won their only previous game against an Australian opposition in the competition. Vissel Kobe won their last AFC Champions League Elite game against Shanghai Port by a 3-0 margin; however, they have not won consecutive games in the competition since their three-match winning run between October and November 2024.

programme.title: Vissel Kobe (JPN) vs Melbourne City FC (AUS) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - East MD2
programme.desc: This will be the first AFC Champions League Elite fixture between Vissel Kobe and Melbourne City; City are without a win in any of their three Champions League Elite games against Japanese sides, while Kobe have won their only previous game against an Australian opposition in the competition. Vissel Kobe won their last AFC Champions League Elite game against Shanghai Port by a 3-0 margin; however, they have not won consecutive games in the competition since their three-match winning run between October and November 2024.

programme.title: Shanghai Shenhua FC (CHN) vs Ulsan HD FC (KOR) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - East MD2
programme.desc: Ulsan HD have won each of their three AFC Champions League Elite games against Shanghai Shenhua, scoring at least two goals in each of those games; in fact, they have won seven of their last eight such fixtures against Chinese teams, with their only defeat in that period being a 1-3 loss to Shanghai Port on 26 November 2024. Shanghai Shenhua have failed to score two or more goals in each of their last three AFC Champions League Elite fixtures, the last time they went on a longer such run was a stretch of six games between April 2009 and April 2011.

programme.title: Race 2 - World Super Bike - Estoril Round 2025
programme.desc: WorldSBK heads to Estoril for the weekend’s decisive Race 2. The long front straight and technical infield reward grip and bravery, with braking into Parabólica and the drag to Turn 1 often settling it. Expect drafting trains, tyre-management gambles, and late lunges as title hopes to tighten in a full-throttle finale.

programme.title: Race 2 - World Super Bike - Estoril Round 2025

programme.title: Race 5 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: Rising talents go wheel-to-wheel at Misano World Circuit Marco Simoncelli in Race 5. Slipstreams on the main straight and commitment through Curvone shape the order, while track limits, safety cars, and bold restarts can flip everything late. A flat-out sprint where newcomers and title hopefuls fight to the flag.

programme.title: Race 1 - Hockenheim Round - Porsche Cup Germany
programme.desc: Sprint battles at Hockenheim’s 4.57 km circuit. A 30-car grid of identical 911 GT3 Cup machines (about 510 hp) puts race craft and consistency under pressure across two points-paying races that shape the title fight.

programme.title: Chelsea vs Benfica - UEFA Champions League 2025/26 - MD2
programme.desc: Chelsea have won all four of their competitive meetings with Benfica, with the most recent of those coming earlier this year at the FIFA Club World Cup. This will be the first meeting between Chelsea and Benfica in the group/league phase of a competition, with the previous four all having come in the knockout stages: UEFA Champions League quarter-finals in 2011-12, UEFA Europa League final in 2012-13 and the FIFA Club World Cup last 16 earlier this year.

programme.title: FC Viktoria Plzeň vs Malmö FF - UEFA Europa League 2025/2026 - MD2
programme.desc: The 2025–26 UEFA Europa League is the secondary club football tournament organised by UEFA. This is the second season played under a new format, which replaced the 32-team group stage with a 36-team league phase. Tottenham Hotspur are the reigning champions. The final will be played on 20 May 2026 at Beşiktaş Stadium in Istanbul, Turkey.

programme.title: Delfina Brea Senesi (ARG) / Gemma Triay Pons (ESP) vs Ariana Sanchez Fallada (ESP) / Paula Josemari
programme.desc: World No.1 pairing Gemma Triay/Delfina Brea face No.2 Ariana Sánchez/Paula Josemaría at Rotterdam Ahoy. A classic rivalry: Triay/Brea lead the season with multiple titles, including Germany P2 last week, while Sánchez/Josemaría chase revenge after losing six of seven meetings this year. Expect sharp returns, low volleys, and golden-point pressure in a battle for supremacy.

programme.title: Race 1 - World Super Bike - Estoril Round 2025
Race 1 - World Super Bike - Estoril Round 2025
Race 1 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: The Misano weekend opens with a sprint that rewards clean starts, tyre warm-up and bravery through Curvone. Expect late dives into Turn 1, heavy braking at Quercia and traction duels out of Tramonto onto the back straight. Safety cars and track-limits calls can flip the order, while newcomers hunt points and title hopefuls set the tone for the round.

programme.title: Race 1 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: The Misano weekend opens with a sprint that rewards clean starts, tyre warm-up and bravery through Curvone. Expect late dives into Turn 1, heavy braking at Quercia and traction duels out of Tramonto onto the back straight. Safety cars and track-limits calls can flip the order, while newcomers hunt points and title hopefuls set the tone for the round.

programme.title: Race 2 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: Race 2 reshuffles the deck after overnight tweaks. Warmer track temps raise tyre-degradation stakes, making slipstream timing on the main straight vital. Inside lines at Turn 1 and measured exits from Tramonto decide most passes. Watch for undercuts on out-laps, safety-car restarts, and penalties for track limits as contenders bank crucial mid-round points.

programme.title: Race 2 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: Race 2 reshuffles the deck after overnight tweaks. Warmer track temps raise tyre-degradation stakes, making slipstream timing on the main straight vital. Inside lines at Turn 1 and measured exits from Tramonto decide most passes. Watch for undercuts on out-laps, safety-car restarts, and penalties for track limits as contenders bank crucial mid-round points.

programme.title: Race 3 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: With setups refined, Race 3 is often the weekend’s fiercest sprint. Nose-to-tail packs form into Turn 1, while rhythm and patience through the fast right-lefts keep front tyres alive. Curvone commitment and a tidy run to Quercia create overtaking chances. Expect bold moves, defensive elbows, and strategy on push laps to climb

programme.title: Race 4 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: The Misano finale. Championship hopefuls chase maximum points as fatigue, tyre life and track limits shape the last attacks. A strong launch, disciplined braking at Quercia and perfect traction from Tramonto decide podiums. Anticipate safety-car drama, photo-finish drafts to the stripe, and decisive moves under pressure as the round closes with a flat-out sprint.

programme.desc: WorldSBK heads to Estoril for the weekend’s decisive Race 2. programme.title: Al Rayyan vs Qatar Club - Qatar Stars League 2025/26 - W4
programme.desc: The Qatari League is the official football league in Qatar. The league includes 12 teams. The Qatari league includes star names such as Firmino, Verratti, and Qatari Akram Afif, the best player in Asia.

programme.title: Saint-Raphaël vs Toulouse - LNH Division 1 - French Handball Starligue
programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. Established in 1952, this premier league event features 16 top teams battling for glory. With Montpellier’s 14 Handball titles and Paris Saint-Germain's 11 wins, the competition is fierce. programme.title: DTM Show 2025-Red Bull Ring Part 1
programme.desc: DTM. The embodiment of Motorsport tradition. Having just turned 40, the DTM combines a unique fascination and familiarity with an unmistakable dynamic, signified by the rebranding with a new logo! Seven different manufacturers – ten different winners on six brands (Audi, BMW, Mercedes, Lamborghini, Porsche and Ferrari) through twelve races are but one testament to the unique competitive balance that makes every DTM weekend a revelation! And with the addition of Ford, the palette of different brands is only increasing!

programme.title: DTM Show 2025-Red Bull Ring Part 1
programme.desc: DTM. The embodiment of Motorsport tradition. Having just turned 40, the DTM combines a unique fascination and familiarity with an unmistakable dynamic, signified by the rebranding with a new logo! Seven different manufacturers – ten different winners on six brands (Audi, BMW, Mercedes, Lamborghini, Porsche and Ferrari) through twelve races are but one testament to the unique competitive balance that makes every DTM weekend a revelation! And with the addition of Ford, the palette of different brands is only increasing!

programme.title: M1 - ATP 250 - BNP Paribas Nordic Open - Stockholm 2025
programme.desc: Stockholm (13–19 Oct). Indoor hard at Kungliga Tennishallen. Draws: 28 singles / 16 doubles. Prize money: €706,850. Expect fast, first-strike tennis — big serves, sharp returns, and tight tie-breaks. Home favorites and rising talents push for autumn ranking points and a Sunday trophy.
